page.title: 06CARNIVAL DAY IN LLANGADOG
page.content: Carnival day is an exciting day in Llangadog.It's usually held on the first Saturday of July as it's always fine on that date.This year (1985) it will be held on the 6th July.On the morning of the carnival people rush to prepare the lorries which carry Prince Charming,Fairy,Rose & Carnival Queens and attendants.These were chosen at a concert in the Community Centre in May.At 1.30 p.m the lorries decorated with flowers and carrying the Queens parade through the village to the playing field.Many watch the parade as it passes through the village square. On the field,the Queens are crowned and the fancy dress winners are chosen.Later there are Sports for the children whilst the adults drink tea. This tiring but happy day ends with a Disco Dance at the Community Centre.
